html.p: This app is designed for DAFI users with the admin role and/or its associated capabilities.
Navigate using the menu at the top to analyze the Splunk deployment.
Searches return metrics from Splunk's _internal and _audit indexes, the Splunk REST API, and more.
html.h3: What can I find out using the DAFI app?
html.p: Splunk provides an immense amount of data on itself. The DAFI app is intended to serve as a central location for key project metrics around security, system adoption, and resource utilization. Use cases are generally centered around the following questions:
html.ul: How are users provided access to data?
Who searches the data and what do they search?
Is data being ingested as expected?

html.p: Splunk searches are typically written with a query returning results, followed by commands. Commands are preceded by a pipe character | as follows:

pre.code: index=myindex sourcetype=mysourcetype | stats count by host | sort - count

html.p: Some Splunk reporting commands, however, are not preceded by a search query and are invoked directly after a | character in the first line. These commands include but are not limited to tstats, mstats, mcatalog, REST, metadata, dbinspect, fieldsummary, and history. The REST API in particular warrants example:

search.query: | rest /servicesNS/-/-/data/ui/views | search eai:acl.app=admin_assistant | fields label title description rootNode author version eai:acl.owner eai:userName eai:acl.perms.write eai:acl.perms.read eai:appName updated | sort - updated
